chunks.en: Three choices for freshmen: iPhone, iPad, laptop

My sister-in-law has twin daughters who will take the college entrance examination next year, and it is estimated that they will attend either 985 or 211 universities.
Which one to give them that will be most helpful for their studies, with a budget of no more than 12,000 yuan?
I have never been to college, so I am here to ask for your advice, everyone!
Get an iPad. They already have phones, and the family will provide computers if needed.
Get an iPad. In college, it's one of the few places where an iPad can fully demonstrate its learning capabilities, such as taking notes and reading books.
Must choose one of the three? It's better to just give a big red envelope.
iPad + pen, I think iPad Air5 + second-generation pen will be enough. If it's the top configuration, it'll cost 6,000, and two would cost 12,000.
iPads are for iQiyi in the first and second years of university, and most female students rarely use laptops in their third year for the postgraduate entrance examination.

chunks.en: Non-CS majors using a MacBook may encounter the following problems: 1. USB flash drives not recognized. 2. Problems opening and editing school-issued materials and documents on macOS. 3. Dealing with all sorts of frustrating things on macOS, and fewer solutions are indexed by search engines than on Windows. 4. High price and maintenance costs. 5. The use of cracked software is an objective reality for those with no income, and Macs are less friendly than Windows in this respect. The way to eliminate the problem is to prevent it from taking root. No one will ask an iPad to play the role of a laptop.
Just ask them directly, it's not a small amount of money, what's the point of guessing?

chunks.en: iPads are quite useful for college students, and it's very convenient for viewing PDF courseware or online classes, which can be said to be one of the scenarios where iPads can best exert their productivity functions. Two laptops with a 12k budget can only buy mid-range or lower-end ones, and a new Pro version of iPhone can't be bought either. If you don't mind using Pinduoduo, 12k should be enough to buy two 256G 11-inch M2 iPad Pros? Also, with a university admission notice, you can get the Apple education discount. You can consider buying an iPad during the back-to-school season and get AirPods (Pro) for free/at a low price.
Honestly, in university classrooms now, 8 out of 10 people are holding iPads.
MacBook Pro M1 is sufficient.
